intro: Pterotheca nemausensis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pterotheca, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a slightly hairy surface, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Pterotheca nemausensis is relatively uncommon and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
